clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Application of BioCleanse Meniscus Registry

brief_summary.textblock: This study will follow patients after routine surgery of a meniscal allograft transplant.

detailed_description.textblock: The BioCleanse meniscus is available to to all orthopedic surgeons for transplantation. The purpose of this registry is to allow close monitoring of a subgroup of patients receiving the BioCleanse Meniscus. All patients who have selected a BioCleanse Meniscus for their Meniscal Allograft transplant will be asked to join the registry. Outcomes will be measured by subjective subject questionnaires as well as X-rays and MRI.

primary_outcome.measure: Subjective subject questionnaire scores as well as X-ray and MRI evaluations
primary_outcome.time_frame: Subject questionnaires at 4 weeks, 6 months, 12 months, 24 months and 60 months. X-rays at 4 weeks and 12 months. MRI at 6 months (optional) and 12 months.

intervention.description: Subjects will undergo routine meniscal allograft transplant surgery.

study_pop.textblock: All patients, between the ages of 18 and 55 years, who have selected meniscal allograft transplantation (MAT) using BioCleanse allografts will be eligible to participate in the MAT registry.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients, up to 10 who have selected a BioCleanse Meniscus transplant
Exclusion Criteria:
- Anyone not eligible for a meniscal transplant
